tactics.name: Reconnaissance
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather information they can use to plan future operations.

tactics.name: ResourceDevelopment
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to establish resources they can use to support operations.

tactics.name: InitialAccess
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

tactics.name: Execution
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

tactics.name: Persistence
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

tactics.name: PrivilegeEscalation
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

tactics.name: DefenseEvasion
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

tactics.name: CredentialAccess
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

tactics.name: Discovery
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

tactics.name: LateralMovement
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

tactics.name: Collection
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

tactics.name: CommandAndControl
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them.

tactics.name: Exfiltration
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

tactics.name: Impact
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

techniques.name: Active Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans to gather information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Scanning IP Blocks
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan victim IP blocks to gather information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan victims for vulnerabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Wordlist Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may iteratively probe infrastructure using brute-force methods to achieve successful logins to a system.

techniques.name: Gather Victim Network Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's networks that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Domain Properties
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's network domain(s) that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: DNS
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's DNS that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Network Trust Dependencies
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's network trust dependencies that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Network Topology
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's network topology that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: IP Addresses
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather the victim's IP addresses that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Network Security Appliances
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's network security appliances that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Gather Victim Org Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's organization that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Determine Physical Locations
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather the victim's physical location(s) that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Business Relationships
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's business relationships that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Identify Business Tempo
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's business tempo that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Identify Roles
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about identities and roles within the victim organization that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Phishing for Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing messages via third-party services to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious attachment to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Link
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious link to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Voice
techniques.description: Adversaries may use voice communications to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Closed Sources of Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may search and gather information about victims from closed sources that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Threat Intel Vendors
techniques.description: Adversaries may search private data from threat intelligence vendors for information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Purchase Technical Data
techniques.description: Adversaries may purchase technical information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Open Technical Databases
techniques.description: Adversaries may search freely available technical databases for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: DNS/Passive DNS
techniques.description: Adversaries may search DNS data for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: WHOIS
techniques.description: Adversaries may search public WHOIS data for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Digital Certificates
techniques.description: Adversaries may search public digital certificate data for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: CDNs
techniques.description: Adversaries may search content delivery network (CDN) data about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Scan Databases
techniques.description: Adversaries may search within public scan databases for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Open Websites/Domains
techniques.description: Adversaries may search freely available websites and/or domains for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Social Media
techniques.description: Adversaries may search social media for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Engines
techniques.description: Adversaries may use search engines to collect information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Code Repositories
techniques.description: Adversaries may search public code repositories for information about victims that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Victim-Owned Websites
techniques.description: Adversaries may search websites owned by the victim for information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Acquire Infrastructure
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, lease, or rent infrastructure that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Domains
techniques.description: Adversaries may acquire domains that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: DNS Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may set up their own Domain Name System (DNS) servers that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Virtual Private Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may rent Virtual Private Servers (VPSs) that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, lease, or rent physical servers that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Botnet
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, lease, or rent a network of compromised systems that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Web Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may register for web services that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Serverless
techniques.description: Adversaries may purchase and configure serverless cloud infrastructure, such as Cloudflare Workers or AWS Lambda functions, that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Compromise Infrastructure
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise third-party infrastructure that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Domains
techniques.description: Adversaries may hijack domains and/or subdomains that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: DNS Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise third-party DNS servers that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Virtual Private Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise third-party Virtual Private Servers (VPSs) that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Server
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise third-party servers that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Botnet
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise numerous third-party systems to form a botnet that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Web Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise access to third-party web services that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Serverless
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise serverless cloud infrastructure, such as Cloudflare Workers or AWS Lambda functions, that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Malvertising
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise advertising networks to deliver malicious ads to users.

techniques.name: Establish Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may create and cultivate accounts with services that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Social Media Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may create and cultivate social media accounts that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Email Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may create email accounts that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Cloud Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may create accounts with cloud providers that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Compromise Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise accounts with services that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Social Media Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise social media accounts that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Email Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise email accounts that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Cloud Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may compromise cloud accounts that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Develop Capabilities
techniques.description: Adversaries may build capabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Malware
techniques.description: Adversaries may develop malware and malware components that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Code Signing Certificates
techniques.description: Adversaries may create self-signed code signing certificates that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Digital Certificates
techniques.description: Adversaries may create self-signed SSL/TLS certificates that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Exploits
techniques.description: Adversaries may develop exploits that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Obtain Capabilities
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy and/or steal capabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Malware
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, steal, or download malware that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Tool
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, steal, or download software tools that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Code Signing Certificates
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy and/or steal code signing certificates that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Digital Certificates
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy and/or steal SSL/TLS certificates that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Exploits
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, steal, or download exploits that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Vulnerabilities
techniques.description: Adversaries may acquire information about vulnerabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious attachment in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Link
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious link in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing via Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing messages via third-party services in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Voice
techniques.description: Adversaries may use voice communications to ultimately gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Replication Through Removable Media
techniques.description: Adversaries may move onto systems, possibly those on disconnected or air-gapped networks, by copying malware to removable media and taking advantage of Autorun features when the media is inserted into a system and executes.

techniques.name: Supply Chain Compromise
techniques.description: Adversaries may manipulate products or product delivery mechanisms prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise.

techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
techniques.description: Adversaries may manipulate software dependencies and development tools prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise.

techniques.name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
techniques.description: Adversaries may manipulate application software prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise.

techniques.name: Compromise Hardware Supply Chain
techniques.description: Adversaries may manipulate hardware components in products prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise.

techniques.name: Trusted Relationship
techniques.description: Adversaries may breach or otherwise leverage organizations who have access to intended victims.

techniques.name: Hardware Additions
techniques.description: Adversaries may introduce computer accessories, networking hardware, or other computing devices into a system or network that can be used as a vector to gain access.

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Default Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a default account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Domain Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a domain account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Local Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a local account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Cloud Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a cloud account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.

techniques.name: External Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services to initially access and/or persist within a network.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

techniques.name: PowerShell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.

techniques.name: AppleScript
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse AppleScript for execution.

techniques.name: Windows Command Shell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution.

techniques.name: Unix Shell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Unix shell commands and scripts for execution.

techniques.name: Visual Basic
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Visual Basic (VB) for execution.

techniques.name: Python
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Python commands and scripts for execution.

techniques.name: JavaScript
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse various implementations of JavaScript for execution.

techniques.name: Network Device CLI
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse scripting or built-in command line interpreters (CLI) on network devices to execute malicious command and payloads.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task/Job
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality to facilitate initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: At
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the at utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Cron
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Cron
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse cron in Linux and Unix environments to execute programs at system startup or on a scheduled basis for Persistence.

techniques.name: Launchd
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the macOS launchd process to maintain persistence or escalate privileges.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Systemd Timers
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse systemd timers to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Container Orchestration Job
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality provided by container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes to schedule deployment of containers configured to execute malicious code.

techniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to execute malicious commands and payloads.

techniques.name: User Execution
techniques.description: An adversary may rely upon specific actions by a user in order to gain execution.

techniques.name: Malicious Link
techniques.description: An adversary may rely upon a user clicking a malicious link in order to gain execution.

techniques.name: Malicious File
techniques.description: An adversary may rely upon a user opening a malicious file in order to gain execution.

techniques.name: Malicious Image
techniques.description: Adversaries may rely on a user running a malicious image to facilitate execution.

techniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to execute malicious commands and payloads.

techniques.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
techniques.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon to maintain persistence or gain higher-level privileges on compromised systems.

techniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
techniques.description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or referencing it with a Registry run key.

techniques.name: Authentication Package
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse authentication packages to execute DLLs when the system boots.

techniques.name: Time Providers
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse time providers to execute DLLs when the system boots.

techniques.name: Winlogon Helper DLL
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in.

techniques.name: Security Support Provider
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse security support providers (SSPs) to execute DLLs when the system boots.

techniques.name: Kernel Modules and Extensions
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify the kernel to automatically execute programs on system boot.

techniques.name: Re-opened Applications
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify plist files to automatically run an application when a user logs in.

techniques.name: LSASS Driver
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify or add LSASS drivers to obtain persistence on compromised systems.

techniques.name: Shortcut Modification
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify shortcuts that can execute a program during system boot or user login.

techniques.name: Port Monitors
techniques.description: Adversaries may use port monitors to run an adversary supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation.

techniques.name: Plist Modification
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify property list files (plist files) to enable other malicious activity, while also potentially evading and persistenting in the system.

techniques.name: Print Processors
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse print processors to run malicious DLLs during system boot for persistence and/or privilege escalation.

techniques.name: XDG Autostart Entries
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify XDG autostart entries to execute programs or commands during system boot.

techniques.name: Active Setup
techniques.description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a Registry key to the Active Setup of the local machine.

techniques.name: Login Items
techniques.description: Adversaries may add login items to execute upon user login to gain persistence or escalate privileges.

techniques.name: Create or Modify System Process
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify system-level processes to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Launch Agent
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify launch agents to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Systemd Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify systemd services to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Windows Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify Windows services to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Launch Daemon
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify Launch Daemons to execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Event Triggered Execution
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges using system mechanisms that trigger execution based on specific events.

techniques.name: Change Default File Association
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by a file type association.

techniques.name: Screensaver
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.

techniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event subscription.

techniques.name: .bash_profile and .bashrc
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by a user's shell.

techniques.name: Trap
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by an interrupt signal.

techniques.name: LC_LOAD_DYLIB Addition
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by the execution of tainted binaries.

techniques.name: Netsh Helper DLL
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by Netsh Helper DLLs.

techniques.name: Accessibility Features
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by accessibility features.

techniques.name: AppCert DLLs
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by AppCert DLLs loaded into processes.

techniques.name: AppInit DLLs
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by AppInit DLLs loaded into processes.

techniques.name: Application Shimming
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.

techniques.name: Image File Execution Options Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by Image File Execution Options (IFEO) debuggers.

techniques.name: PowerShell Profile
techniques.description: Adversaries may gain persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by PowerShell profiles.

techniques.name: Emond
techniques.description: Adversaries may gain persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by the Event Monitor Daemon (emond).

techniques.name: Component Object Model Hijacking
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by hijacked references to Component Object Model (COM) objects.

techniques.name: Installer Packages
techniques.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by using an installer to trigger the execution of malicious content.

techniques.name: Process Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Portable Executable Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject portable executables (PE) into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Thread Execution Hijacking
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into hijacked processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Asynchronous Procedure Call
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into processes via the asynchronous procedure call (APC) queue in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Thread Local Storage
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into processes via thread local storage (TLS) callbacks in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Ptrace System Calls
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into processes via ptrace (process trace) system calls in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Proc Memory
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into processes via the /proc filesystem in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Extra Window Memory Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into process via Extra Window Memory (EWM) in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Process Hollowing
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into suspended and hollowed processes in order to evade process-based defenses.

techniques.name: Process Doppelgänging
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into process via process doppelgänging in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: VDSO Hijacking
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject malicious code into processes via VDSO hijacking in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: ListPlanting
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse list-view controls to inject malicious code into hijacked processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Access Token Manipulation
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify access tokens to operate under a different user or system security context to perform actions and bypass access controls.

techniques.name: Token Impersonation/Theft
techniques.description: Adversaries may duplicate then impersonate another user's existing token to escalate privileges and bypass access controls.

techniques.name: Create Process with Token
techniques.description: Adversaries may create a new process with an existing token to escalate privileges and bypass access controls.

techniques.name: Make and Impersonate Token
techniques.description: Adversaries may make new tokens and impersonate users to escalate privileges and bypass access controls.

techniques.name: Parent PID Spoofing
techniques.description: Adversaries may spoof the parent process identifier (PPID) of a new process to evade process-monitoring defenses or to elevate privileges.

techniques.name: SID-History Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may use SID-History Injection to escalate privileges and bypass access controls.

techniques.name: Impair Defenses
techniques.description: Adversaries may maliciously modify components of a victim's defense to avoid detection or aid in their operations.

techniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify and/or disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their malware/tools and activities.

techniques.name: Disable Windows Event Logging
techniques.description: Adversaries may disable Windows event logging to limit data that can be leveraged for detections and audits.

techniques.name: Impair Command History Logging
techniques.description: Adversaries may impair command history logging to hide commands they run on a compromised system.

techniques.name: Disable or Modify System Firewall
techniques.description: Adversaries may disable or modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage.

techniques.name: Indicator Blocking
techniques.description: An adversary may attempt to block indicators or events typically captured by sensors from being gathered and analyzed.

techniques.name: Disable or Modify Cloud Firewall
techniques.description: Adversaries may disable or modify a firewall within a cloud environment to bypass controls that limit access to cloud resources.

techniques.name: Disable or Modify Cloud Logs
techniques.description: An adversary may disable or modify cloud logging capabilities and integrations to limit what data is collected on their activities and avoid detection.

techniques.name: Safe Mode Boot
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Windows safe mode to disable endpoint defenses.

techniques.name: Downgrade Attack
techniques.description: Adversaries may downgrade or use a version of system features that may be outdated, vulnerable, and/or does not support updated security controls such as logging.

techniques.name: Indicator Removal
techniques.description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts generated within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses.

techniques.name: Clear Windows Event Logs
techniques.description: Adversaries may clear Windows Event Logs to hide the activity of an intrusion.

techniques.name: Clear Linux or Mac System Logs
techniques.description: Adversaries may clear system logs to hide evidence of an intrusion.

techniques.name: Clear Command History
techniques.description: In addition to clearing system logs, an adversary may clear the command history of a compromised account to conceal the actions undertaken during an intrusion.

techniques.name: File Deletion
techniques.description: Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.

techniques.name: Network Share Connection Removal
techniques.description: Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation.

techniques.name: Timestomp
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify file time attributes to hide new or changes to existing files.

techniques.name: Clear Network Connection History and Configurations
techniques.description: Adversaries may clear or remove evidence of malicious network connections in order to clean up traces of their operations.

techniques.name: Clear Mailbox Data
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify mail and mail application data to remove evidence of their activity.
